newsitem.title: USA: LHS IPO terms cut sharply in regulatory filing.
newsitem.headline: LHS IPO terms cut sharply in regulatory filing.

text.p: LHS Group Inc sharply cut the terms of its proposed initial public offering in a filing Friday with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
LHS cut both the number of shares to be offered and the price range, to four million shares at $12 to $14 each.

In its first filing in February, LHS estimated it would raise about $88 million in gross proceeds through an offering of 5,883,000 shares at $14 to $16 each. Earlier this week it raised the price range to $15 to $17.
LHS provides client/server-based billing and customer care solutions to providers of wireless and wireline telecommunications services.
The shares are to trade on the Nasdaq under the symbol "LHSG."
